reviews.text: The food here was delicious and it came out quick. The servers were attentive and kind. I would definitely come back here again.
They have many vegan options and are very accommodating. Food is excellent too.
Cute place
Great mook kung kra Ree
Very good very good most authentic pad Thai

My financ√© and I LOVE this place! We live in the neighborhood and go all the time. It‚Äôs the best Thai food around and always an amazing atmosphere with incredible service. Just had dinner with some friends and Honeybee was our server - she was incredible and so so sweet. Best restaurant around!
Such a wonderful experience! Honey Bee was a great server, will be back!
Great restaurant! Highly recommend!

THE PHO SMELLED LIKE AZZ AND IT TASTED LIKE THE SMELL OF OLD MOP WATER. WE CAME TO EAT FOR MY SON‚Äôs GRADUATION. THEY HAD THE 6 OF US SIT AT SEPARATED TABLES BY THE OPEN DOOR AND THE WEATHER WAS VERY COOL, WINDY, AND RAINY. I ASKED FOR THE GROUP TABLE AND THEY DECLINED, BUT THEY LET A WHITE COUPLE SIT THERE LOL. I MADE SURE THE WAITER GOT AN $80 TIP FROM MY DAD. HE SMILED AND THEN MADE A NASTY FACE SOON AS WE TURNED OUR BACKS, BUT I CAUGHT IT. HE TRIED TO FIX IT SMH TOO LATE. THEY WERE RACIST, NOT REALIZING WE COULD PROBABLY BE RELATED. SMH NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN. THE WHITE RICE IS GOOD. BROCCOLI TOO. ‚úåÔ∏è FIX YALL NASTY ATTITUDES AND DO BETTER.
Great experience, highly recommend!

If you‚Äôre searching for authentic Thai food in New York, Muse Thai NYC is a must-visit! From the moment you walk in, the aroma, presentation, and balance of flavors transport you straight to Bangkok. Every dish feels elevated yet comforting modern Thai cuisine done right.

We tried the Spicy Wagyu Beef, perfectly tender with just the right heat, and the Branzino, which was fresh, flaky, and full of vibrant Thai spices. The Muse Bay Noodles were a highlight bold, saucy, and packed with flavor. For appetizers, the VS Wings (with both BKK Wings and Thom Wings flavors) were crispy, juicy, and addictive, while the Pork Bao was soft and savory perfection.

To drink, the Mojito Fizzy and Non-Alcoholic Negroni were refreshing and beautifully crafted the kind of mocktails that prove you don‚Äôt need alcohol to have a great time.

The ambiance is cozy yet sophisticated, with excellent service and presentation that matches the quality of the food. Whether you‚Äôre planning a date night, dinner with friends, or just exploring Thai cuisine, Muse Thai stands out as one of the top Thai restaurants in NYC.
The food is very delicious with big portion and I like the service here.
The red curry is excellent, full of flavor of coconut milk. Recommend everyone to order Lychee Martini, must try!
Delicious dishes, especially the crispy pork and pad kra pao. Lovely ambience. Beautiful interior. Great service. Overall a solid Thai spot in BK! Highly recommend.

After finishing the New York Marathon, my friends and I were craving something comforting, flavorful, and satisfying ‚Äî and Muse Thai absolutely delivered. We walked in still wearing our medals, tired but excited, and were greeted with warm smiles and the amazing aroma of Thai spices.

Every dish hit the spot. Pure comfort food after 26.2 miles.

Service was kind and quick, even though we were a big, hungry group. The staff congratulated us on finishing the marathon, which made the experience even more special.
If you're looking for a place to refuel with amazing flavors, generous portions, and genuine hospitality, Muse Thai is the place. After running across all five boroughs, this meal tasted like victory.
Such a great space! Cocktails are fun. Highly recommend the pork belly basil fried rice and the Thom Wings!
solid thai food in bk!!! rly liked the crispy pork
Found bug in food, ewww
our go to thai spot, i‚Äôve tried a few different dishes and they‚Äôre always consistently good

Came here on Halloween dinner. Pleasantly surprised by how good the service was considering how packed they were. The food came out very quick and was delicious. Would definitely recommend the crispy pork with rice! I just wish the food could be more ‚Äúthai‚Äù spicy, but other than that, the food was amazing!

I don‚Äôt know if there is a word in the English language that can describe how incredible the service is at Muse. Everyone is extremely delightful and I challenge you to finish a glass of water before it refilled (you won‚Äôt be able to). The food is excellent and has large portions. The overall experience is maybe as good as you‚Äôll get in nyc.
The food was amazing, KK was a very kind server. Highly recommend!

Our experience at Muse was ok but not phenomenal. The food was pretty good but not stand out, affordable for the location. The cocktails were tasty!
Service was impatient and felt rather annoyed with us the whole time. Frequently they tried to clear dishes far before they were done (a couple ribs still on the plate, 1/3 cocktail left, we had to ask them to drop//bring back the plate multiple times). We were not moving slow and there were open tables but our waitress was pushy.
Maybe worth a try but not convinced about all the 5-star reviews.
I have been coming here for years with my family Great food, amazing desert & even better service.
Delicious food and a wonderful ambience!
Amazing neighborhood spot!
FABULOUS!!  Food is SO good and the service is wonderful!!  The staff is very friendly. This restaurant is beautiful too!!
such a nice vibe here! everything is beautiful so happy to have this neighborhood spot
Such a cute place!
so cute!
Had a wonderful time at Muse Thai! Got the minced basil chicken lunch special and it was a large portion and delicious!
Great service! They were literally bringing fresh napkins. Food was nice too, great presentation. Vibes are chill and warm, and they play a bunch of covers the whole time.
Food was delicious and the portion sizing was great. Ordered the drunken noodles, grilled pork sticky rice, and curry rolls, which was good for two people to share.
We ordered the muse roti, drunken noodles and the 4-wheel drive soup and it was amazing! Each dish had its own unique umami flavor and our collective minds were blown
Lovely atmosphere and service was so attentive ! Yummy food and drinks
Thai Tea so GoodÔºÅ

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our experience here. We started with the duck buns, which were delicious and perfectly tangy. We also shared two main dishes: the Drunken Noodles and the Muse Curry- both of which were flavorful and satisfying. The ambiance was calm and relaxing, and our waitress provided quick, attentive service.
Only in this restaurant, yummy!
Everything was delicious and very flavorful. Quick service and very attentive. Would return
Nice restaurant and good environmentüòç
Tucked away and underrated. Really great authentic flavors
Amazing!! Beautiful ambiance and great food. Solid local spot.
Beautiful ambience!! Great food
great dishes
Delicious food and excellent service.
Great service and great dishes. Will recommend!
Very good ambiance and good service. Will recommend the Thai iced coffee and drunken noodle.
Portion size is huge and I love their drunken noodles!
Everything tastes good and the service is great. Will recommend stopping by.
Nice food and cocktails üçπ

Muse is located right next to the traffic light ‚Äî super easy to spot! üö¶
The food here is amazing, especially the Pad Ka Pow Beef and Crispy Pork Belly Basil Fried Rice, both are must-tries! üêÆüê∑
I also really love their duck, it‚Äôs flavorful and tender.
The outdoor setting feels just like dining in a beautiful garden üå∏, so relaxing and enjoyable.
Plus, the Thai staff are incredibly friendly and attentive üáπüá≠

Muse Thai is such a hidden gem! üß° The food is amazing ‚Äî especially the Drunken Noodles and Tom Yum soup, so flavorful and comforting. The restaurant feels cozy, the staff are super nice, and everything tastes freshly made. Definitely one of my favorite Thai spots in New York!

Just had an amazing viewing at 635 Grand and finished with lunch at Muse Thai downstairs. This place is an absolute gem! The food is out of this world ‚Äì the grilled meats are as good as any top Texas BBQ joint. The crispy pork skin and coconut ice cream are a must. If you're touring apartments in Brooklyn, you have to see this building and then eat here. It's the perfect combo! A 5-star experience all around.

Absolutely loved this Thai restaurant! The food was flavorful and authentic ‚Äî every dish was beautifully presented and packed with the perfect balance of spice and aroma. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made great recommendations. Highly recommend the Pad Thai and green curry! Cozy atmosphere and reasonable prices. Will definitely be coming back.

Stopped by for lunch and had a great experience! The food is flavorful and delicious. We got the lunch specials - spicy basil chicken and roast pork - as well as a papaya salad. Definitely would recommend!

Went here on Monday around 4:30pm when they had just opened for dinner, so it was pretty quiet at first. It was our first visit, but Alex was very extremely friendly and he introduced us to their specialties. I especially liked the BBQ pork appetizer. The meat was very tender and the sauce hit my Cantonese taste buds perfectly. The beef rib massaman curry was also excellent too. We requested it not too spicy and it turned out extremely flavorful. I also really appreciated the little details, like the decor and presentation of the dishes. The overall vibe was great, and I'd love to come back again on a Tuesday night to enjoy the live Jazz!

Omg, so delicious. I had the roasted pork with rice dish. Sauce was so good - kinda tangy, sweet and ever so spicy. I also had the coconut ice cream for dessert which was excellent. The staff were super nice and kind as well.

Lunch special is amazing! You get a lot and it‚Äôs great price. Wings were so sticky and spicy and crispy outside juicy inside. The 4 Wheel Drive soup has a Tom Yum base with noodles and egg and chicken. delicious!

Walking in the decor was on point. We sat very quickly and our waitress yatika was very attentive and quick to add some suggestions for the meals as it was my first time here. The beer was cold the Thai ice tea was great. The duck was crispy and the broth was to die for. Desert was a good way to end the meal as it was light but tasty and the service was top notch. Will be back very soon!

Muse Thai completely exceeded my expectations! The portion sizes were generous, making every dish feel satisfying and worth every penny. It‚Äôs rare to find a place that balances quantity with such high quality.

The flavors were spot on‚Äîauthentic, bold, and comforting. From the Drunken Chicken Noodles to the Green Curry Chicken, every bite tasted like a true Thai experience. The Thai Coconut Pudding was the perfect tropical finish!

What made the visit even more special was the excellent service. The staff were friendly, attentive, and happy to customize spice levels to suit our tastes. A must-visit spot for anyone who loves Thai food done right!
Very delicious. The meal was savory and sweet. The sauce is so good. Lemonade was refreshing. I‚Äôve never had mango sticky rice, it‚Äôs different, a good different. I recommend!

Came here for a bite after being at the Brooklyn museum it‚Äôs a 10 min walk away. Totally worth it the food was amazing and fast. Such good flavors! The drunken noodles is soooo good and the duck soup was soooo amazing. They have a really good happy hour drinks are worth it! We all go the Collin‚Äôs and it was so good and tasty. 10/10 will come back again. The waitress was super nice and helpful!

Amazing Thai food for just a little over $20 per person‚Äîso good you‚Äôll be walking out stuffed and happy! Great atmosphere, too. After snapping some shots at the Brooklyn Bridge üì∑, we wandered around looking for a bite and stumbled upon this gorgeous Thai spot. The d√©cor is beautiful, especially the little ‚Äúflower house‚Äù üå∑‚Äîperfect for date nights or catching up with friends. Best of all, the place is packed with locals, which says a lot about how many people keep coming back üëç.

Appetizers:
We picked two ‚Äì chicken wings and rock shrimp ü¶ê. Both were pretty goodüëå.

Main Course:
The fried fish instantly took us back to a Thai night market üáπüá≠.
It was huge ‚Äì way too much for three people to finish. It came with curry and a free bowl of rice üÜìüçö.
For the Pad Thai, I went with duck, based on other reviews I saw on rednote.
Most people usually go for beef or chicken, but the duck was a great choice too! üâë

Dessert:
We had the ü•• coconut pudding ‚Äì super impressive!
We were way too full to order the mango sticky rice!

Absolutely recommend the wagyu beef Fried Rice!! This place is truly a hidden gem! Can‚Äôt believe I didn‚Äôt discover it sooner üò≠The Wagyu fried rice and Tom Yum soup are on another level, definitely worth coming back for.

Portions are generous, the drinks are great! I also heard they have live jazz every Tuesday night üé∫ It‚Äôs such a cozy and atmospheric Thai bar. Highly recommend checking it out!
I only had one appetizer (Muse Roti) and one dessert (Banana Coconut Sticky Rice) but they were excellent and the plating was gorgeous; I ate outside and enjoyed every second üôÇ Highly recommend

Awesome service from the team. I went for the first time by myself and it was so good I came back the next day with my friend for us to enjoy the experience together!

The servers were extremely kind, attentive and gave great recommendations and the quality of food was good as well as portion sizes.

From the atmosphere, to the vibe and the food overall Muse Thai is def one of my go to spots for good quality Thai food!

Muse Thai is a hidden gem in Downtown Brooklyn! The food is consistently flavorful, fresh, and beautifully presented. I had the Pad Ka Pow Beef and Shrimp Muse Curry, and both were packed with bold, authentic Thai flavors. The spice level was just right, and the portions were generous.

The food looks good on pictures but the crab fried rice was too bland that I had to ask for a salt. The another problem was that the salt they provided came out all at once when sprinkling that my fried rice end up being too salty. The beef curry was nice though. The waitresses were rude trying to take away our food and plates while me and my friend were still eating. They kept asking whether we are "doing good" to sound like they care about us but their actions prove that they don't care about what customer truly needs: a leeway for us to enjoy food leisurely. The group next to our table seated after we came was talking really loud and constantly moving in and out, making the couch shake every time they get up. It would have been nice if they were placed in a room empty inside instead.

Good spot to take a girlfriend out.

Food was fresh and very flavorful. As someone who rarely eats Thai food, I entered with an empty stomach and left pleasantly surprised and content.

Heavily recommend.

I had the Thai Iced Tea and the 12 hour simmered Duck Noodle Soup. Both were absolutely delicious. The iced tea wasn‚Äôt too sweet and the soup was extremely flavorful and the duck was tender. I will definitely come back.
I have some critiques of the food (such as the duck is dry and some of the dishes are a bit salty), but overall a pleasant dining experience. The decor is pretty and well thought out.

I found this spot randomly on Google Maps and I knew I had to try it. I ordered a beef pad Thai and it came with a small organic mixed green salad and two vegetable dumplings. Definitely a perfect started app. The pad Thai was so good and it was a good size portion. I would say you can split it with someone. I just ordered water to drink and they would fill my glass as soon as I finished. I was parched so I loved that. The seating was comfortable and spacious. The staff was very friendly as well. I can't wait to go again!

Absolutely love the Wagyu Beef Basil Fried Rice ‚Äî I could eat it 10 times and never get tired of it! Generous portion, great price, and that crispy fried rice with runny egg on top is just perfect. Also loved the Muk Kong Curry ‚Äî rich, creamy, and packed with squid and shrimp, perfect with rice. A true hidden gem in Brooklyn!

I had an amazing dining experience at Muse Thai! This place is such a hidden gem in Brooklyn ‚Äî the food, the ambiance, and the service were all spot-on.

We ordered quite a few dishes and every single one impressed us. The crispy pork belly basil fried rice was my personal favorite ‚Äî super flavorful, with perfectly crisp pork and aromatic basil. The boneless duck drunken noodles were also outstanding: rich, slightly spicy, and loaded with tender duck.

We also had the chicken wings, rock shrimp, and shrimp & calamari in Thai curry ‚Äî all well-executed and seasoned beautifully. For dessert, the banana coconut sticky rice was a comforting, sweet finish. Highly recommend it if you‚Äôre a fan of traditional Thai sweets.

On top of the great food, the atmosphere was lovely. The restaurant has a charming semi-outdoor garden space surrounded by flowers ‚Äî it honestly felt like dining in a little tropical escape. Even the tableware was elegant and thoughtful.

Don‚Äôt miss their cocktails! We tried Passion in You and Purple Love ‚Äî both delicious and visually stunning.

The staff was super friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back, and bringing friends next time!

The shrimp popcorn was super delicious, crispy and flavorful! üç§ The restaurant has such a lovely atmosphere ‚Äî the decorations and flowers are beautiful, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend! üå∏‚ú®

The BBQ pork was absolutely delicious‚Äîtender, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. It really suited our taste! The chicken wings were also amazing‚Äîcrispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and full of flavor. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back again!

The atmosphere is beautiful and relaxing. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The dishes look just as good as the photos and taste amazing‚Äîdefinitely a place I‚Äôd love to come back to! üå∏üç¥

this is an excellent restaurant! the dishes are absolutely delicious, the workers are friendly, and the environment is nice for brunch parties. i would highly suggest this place if you‚Äôre looking for an area that‚Äôs welcoming. definitely coming back!

The food is absolutely delicious and it comes with a big portion! Dunken noodle with crispy duck and the Wagyu fried rice wins the game! The staff is also super friendly in helping and recommending dishes to us! Definitely coming back again for Thai food!

Easily became my favorite Thai spot in Brooklyn. I ordered: (1) mango salad, (2) curry puffs, (3) crispy pork over thai basil fried rice, (4) lava shrimp, and (5) mango sticky rice. My absolute favorite was the crispy pork--crunchy on the outside but tender and fatty on the inside. It paired perfectly with the thai basil fried rice, which cut through the fat of the pork. I was overall impressed with the quality of the mango in the salad and sticky rice, which other thai restaurants often miss. The mangos were perfectly ripe. Service was also great; tentative but not pushy. This would be a great date spot.

For more food reviews, check out chloenicholle on IG!

A Thai restaurant with great style. Their Drunken Noodles are the most highly recommended! I've been dreaming about them ever since trying them at a night market in Thailand, and I haven't seen this dish at any other Thai restaurants in New York. When the Drunken Noodles arrived, the first thing I noticed was that irresistible wok hei aroma. The noodles and squid rings were slightly charred and coated in a savory, sweet, and slightly spicy sauce‚Äîit tasted just like the night market in Thailand!

The other dishes were also excellent:
**BKK Wings** ‚Äì Crispy on the outside and tossed in a sweet, sour, and spicy sauce that really whets the appetite.
**Beef Rib Massaman Curry** ‚Äì The beef ribs were braised until tender, and the curry was rich with a blend of spices. It was delicious paired with roti or rice, especially when mixed with the flavorful sauce.
**Whole Crispy Branzino with Mango Salad** A huge fried fish, perfectly crispy, drizzled with a tangy mango salad dressing. Refreshing and satisfying.

The restaurant also offers many creative cocktails üçπ. On Tuesday nights, starting at 7 PM, there‚Äôs free live jazz music. The vibe is super chill, making it perfect for catching up with friends or a date.

We stumbled into this restaurant and am so glad we did, the vibe is so cozy, ambient, vibey, we were greeted with live music and perfect dim lighting. The service has been so caring and thoughtful and the food was delicious. Excited to come back!
the quality is so rich. i got the chicken pho and veggie steamed dumplings and it was just amazing. evn the salad was delicious. this is my first time here definitely wont be my last

Muse is simply amazing! First off their happy hour which is actually many hours is great. The old fashioned I got was well made and reasonably priced. The Thom and Bkk wings were delicious for an appetizer. We split the beef rib massaman curry and the lava fish, both were out of this world. The service is extremely quick and friendly, even with it being very busy. I absolutely loved it and can‚Äôt wait to go back.
The environment of this restaurant is really great and all the food is delicious. I strongly recommend the fried rice and mango sticky rice. You won't regret it!

I had a wonderful time at Muse!!! The service and food was absolutely phenomenal. I went two days in a row due to the quality and attentiveness of customer service along with  the layers of flavors for each dish I tried.

The portions for the appetizers and main entrees are really generous. I will definitely be back!!

Amazing Thai spot! We got the pad ka pow beef, pad thai, and crispy roasted pork belly over rice ‚Äî all super flavorful and cooked perfectly. The pork belly was a standout ‚Äî crispy, tender, and so good over rice. We also had the Thai iced tea and Dynasty cocktail ‚Äî both hit the spot. Chill vibes, great service. Definitely coming back!

Will definitely be coming back. Friendly service and great atmosphere.  We had the minced chicken and pad se-ew and a few beers for happy hour. We had a lovely time! As a great surprise they also had live music playing on the Tues we went.

Absolutely loved this place! Here are my top picks:
‚Ä¢	Panang Curry (Boneless Duck) ‚Äì MUST TRY! The duck is crispy outside, tender inside, and the coconut curry is perfectly balanced (a little spicy, not too sweet). The sauce alone is worth two bowls of rice. Loved the chestnut-like baby pumpkin too‚Äîrare to find it this good in restaurants.
‚Ä¢	Small Island ‚ÄúKhao Soy‚Äù (Chicken Wings) ‚Äì Rich Tom Yum‚Äìinspired broth with crispy fried noodles on top and instant noodles underneath that soak up all the flavor. Comforting and addictive!
‚Ä¢	Pad Thai (Shrimp) ‚Äì Sweet and classic, with peanuts, lime, and scallions to balance it out. Don‚Äôt miss their house-made chili sauce‚Äîit‚Äôs super fragrant and packs a punch.
‚Ä¢	VS. Wings (BKK & Thom) ‚Äì Thai-style fried chicken wings. The BKK (sweet & sour with a little spice) was my favorite. Thom is more like honey wings, also tasty but less complex.
‚Ä¢	Peanut Dumplings ‚Äì Unique surprise! More like rice rolls stuffed with sweet peanut filling. Chewy, nutty, and fun to try.
‚Ä¢	Mango Sticky Rice ‚Äì Could use a bit more coconut cream, but still satisfying.
‚Ä¢	Cocktails (Just A Minute & Purple Love) ‚Äì Purple Love is fruity and easy to drink, while Just A Minute is stronger with a long finish.

Overall, the flavors were amazing and nothing felt greasy. I‚Äôd definitely come back and highly recommend the duck Panang Curry and the VS. Wings.

The food here is amazing! I definitely recommend the Ming‚Äôs chicken and basil! So flavorful and packed with a Smokey punch. The service was amazing, constantly filling water, checking in, and if you have leftovers they‚Äôll pack it for you! 10/10

Service is great, very attentive and friendly. Asked you how you felt, made conversation but not too much. Great at reading social signals. The drinks were well prepared, tasty and strong (balanced) . Had the Cuba Libre (for stronger folks) and Island breeze (when you want it to look pretty) I was just passing by and tried it, I will be returning and recommend üòä
It was a perfect dinner that reminded me of my life in Thailand. Each dish is exquisite and has a lot of portions! The service of the waiters was also very good, polite and well taken care of.
great location! food was exceptionally delicious and fresh. decor was comforting with amazing scenery. can‚Äôt wait to come back ! 10/10
Super friendly staff and cute space! Food was also amazing and I really appreciated how many vegan options they had - loved the green avocado curry and the Thai coconut pudding for dessert!

The most delicious all round meal I've eaten in my life. Muse thank you for creating recipes with these flavors, it was a beautiful experience and can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

Lemonade was a hit!
Appetizers:
bbq ribs outrageously tender, fall off the bone, better than some bbq restaurants.
Pork buns were sweet, sticky, crispy and flavor from the Thai gods.
Wow the Chicken massaman curry was life changing, think last meal of your life scale... like every bite better than the last life changing...like arriving home on a full stomach, dreaming about eating more life changing.
Desert coconut pudding was just WOW

Updated 1 day after: Pondering all night, i wanted to try Muse again, food couldn't be that good, maybe I was starving when I wrote the first review yesterday. Well long story short, it was not a fluke, Muse is a bonafide must try restaurant. No question, no need to think about it, just get up, walk out the door and head straight there.

Chicken wings were crispy, sticky, just finger licking delicious. They should sell that sauce at the supermarket.

Chicken dumplings were also great.

Always consistently tasty. The friendliest most efficient staff too. We‚Äôve been regulars since the pandemic and have tried almost all of their appetizers ‚Äî they‚Äôre all delicious. For their mains, our go-tos are kee mao (always satisfies our primal thai cravings) and the crispy pork belly basil fried rice. Generous happy hour pours, which is a plus!

First time here ! Omg everything was so delish & authentic ! Love the Thai tea , it‚Äôs a good balance of tea flavor and milk ! The BBq pork is a must , so tender and juicy , papaya salad is so refreshing for hot summer days ‚Ä¶ service is so attentive , decor is so cute & aesthetic ! Would love to come back when I‚Äôm in the area ! Mango stick rice is BOMB !

Food was really good, great portion size. The staff was also very friendly and kind. We ordered the red curry and the Muse curry and both were delicious. It was our first time here and I‚Äôll definitely be back
